intro: Hyptis humilis, commonly known as Mexican mint marigold, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a strong, mint-like scent. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hyptis humilis is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fragrance.
